intro: Canthium rubrocostatum, commonly known as the red-costated spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive red-veined leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Canthium rubrocostatum is noted for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
